characters: ... A DOVER OF LIVE DUCKS QUACKING --
HE IS SHOCKED BY THE FORCE OF THE BULLET INTO HIS GUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL (50's) stands on the street under a RAISED TRAIN BRI He covers his ears in UTTER DISGUST at the UNBEARABLE NOI train makes as it ROARS OVERHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BELLOWS TO THE HEAVENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train moves on he walks, slowly, DESPONDENT. Lost private WORLD OF PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him we see a woman in a fur collard coat and flowe hat walking, gaining on him. This is JEANNE (20's).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she PASSES Paul, she turns to GLANCE at him. We read a HINT of EMPATHY on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is OBLIVIOUS to her or anything else for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks on, dodging STREET SWEEPERS as she covers the l walkway, trying to forget the SAD MAN she saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her walk toward a 6 story APARTMENT BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, with TEARS STREAMING DOWN HIS FACE, comes to realit he also notices the building. He REGARDS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne stands looking at the grandeur of the building at RUE JULES VERNE. She reads a FOR RENT sign on the door fr She HESITATES but then RINGS THE BELL. She checks her wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SMILES to herself then descends the nearby stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into a BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne comes in and speaks to the BARTENDER. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone token, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tokens. At the end, on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne goes to the TELEPHONE/WASHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone booth is OCCUPIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she waits, she watches in disgust as an OLD LADY clean her DENTURES with a toothbrush and then puts them back in mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne STUDIES her own face in the MIRROR, puffing her ch up in judgement. As she does, Paul exits the phone booth, still LOST IN ANGUISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After watching him leave, Jeanne USES THE PAY PHONE. She speaks to her MOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama? Yes, it's Jeanne. I've found a flat to rent in Passy. I'm going to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her foot up on the seat. We see her LONG BOOTS a her SHORT SKIRT hikes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I've got to go to the station to met Tom. I promised him. OK, see you later. Bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne talks to THE CRAZY CONCIERGE through a SMALL WINDO who is SMOKING and has ROLLERS in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to see the flat. I saw the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign? 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Concierge joins Jeanne AT THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always the same! Nobody ever tells me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to rent it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rent, they leave and I'm the last to know. Do you think that's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits at her desk and PUTS OUT HER CIGARETTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to go up alone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks through her KEYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. I'm afraid of spiders. The key is missing. Strange things happen. One of the APT. GUESTS puts an empty WINE BOTTLE outside their door. They both TAKE NOTICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink six bottles a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne thinks the place is like a FUNNY FARM. As the concierge TRILLS OUT FIGARO, she gives up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Don't go! There must be a duplicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne, against her better judgement, goes back to the de She holds out her hand. The Concierge puts the KEY IN HER HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be very young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GRABS AND HOLDS ON to Jeanne's hand way too long, LAUGHING CRAZY, HYSTERICAL. Jeanne has to forcefully brea away from her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets free of her and heads to the ELEVATOR, rubbing h hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR arrives and she gets on. We watch her ascend DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne comes in the DARK ROOM and heads straight for the window. She opens it and the STORM SHUTTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light STREAMS IN, revealing Paul, sitting on the RADIATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne is STARTLED when she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me a fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He replies WITHOUT LOOKING AT HER. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I left it open. I didn't hear you come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was already here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry? Oh it was you who took it. I had to bribe the concierge. These old houses are fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up to the FIREPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armchair by the fireplace would look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armchair should go in front of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you American? You've got an American accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets off the radiator and WANDERS into the next room f SOLITUDE.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: But she has followed him. She OPENS THOSE WINDOWS also. H forced into ANOTHER ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he studies a WICKER CHAISE LOUNGE, she calls from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to take it? Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to LOOK AROUND. Her CURIOSITY of Paul gets best of her. She peeks around the corner and watches him IN THE CORNER. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks he is VERY ODD as he PLAYS WITH a lamp shade. Nature calls. She heads to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PHONE RINGS, she pulls up her skirt and sits on th toilet for a PEE. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes and FLUSHES THE TOILET as the PHONE RINGS ON incessantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh la la. Should I answer It or not? Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pick up the phone at the SAME TIME. Paul EAVES DROPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the caller) Hello -- Hello. There's no-one here. There's no-one. I don't know. He puts the SMALL LAMP SHADE back. He hangs the receiver the back of the chaise. Jeanne continues to listen on her end, UNAWARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul SNEAKS AROUND THE CORNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne is STARTLED. She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to take it? You've decided?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had already decided. But I'm not sure now. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's SPEECHLESS. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I shall have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WALKS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne picks her hat off the floor, lost in CONFUSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Paul didn't really leave. He walks slowly TOWARD HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He STUDIES HER for a moment. He takes her hat and DROPS I the ground. He PICKS HER UP in his arms and CARRIES to th window. He puts her down on the window sill. They start MAKING OUT ferociously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RIPS her panty hose, UNDOES HIS ZIPPER and PENETRATES They are lost in ANIMALISTIC SEX as she WRAPS HER legs ar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They KISS SAVAGELY and HIT the floor as THEY CLIMAX TOGET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus... Oh... Oh, Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally spent, they ROLL AWAY from each other. Her skirt, hiked up is showing her ripped panty hose. We can see her AMPLE BUSH through the SHEER FABRIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They WRITHE on the floor trying to CATCH THEIR BREATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes out the FRONT DOOR. He puts on his TRENCH COAT Jeanne LAGS behind, trying to fix herself also. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes the FOR RENT sign off the DOOR FRAME as Jeanne heads off, still STUPEFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her descend the stairs and throws the CRUMPLED sign on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go their SEPARATE WAYS. Jeanne crosses the street wh Paul takes the RAISED WALKWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne RUNS through the crowd IN A PANIC dodging people. finds who she is LOOKING FOR, her boyfriend TOM (30's). S runs into his arms like LONG LOST LOVERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the sudden, a FILM CREW appears, filming their eve moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They KISS PASSIONATELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom tries to UNTANGLE HER from the cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they taken us for someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks her and EXPLAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a film. If I kiss you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KISSES HER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it might be cinema. If I stroke your hair, it might be cinema.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on as the SOUND ENGINEER pokes a MICROPHONE in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Do you know them? 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story. In short, Portrait of a Girl. It's been accepted for television! And the girl is you. It's you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad! You might have asked me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne SMACKS THE MICROPHONE out of their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to start with shots of Jeanne at the station meeting her fiancГ©. Yes, I know them. They're my crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you kissed me, and you knew it was being filmed. You're a bastard! Traitor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you'll see. It will be a love story. Tell me, Jeanne, darling. What did you do while I was away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought of you day and night, and I cried. Darling, I can't live without you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful! Cut! That was perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is THRILLED. He tries to kiss her but she won't let hi She is still MIFFED. But she finally GIVES IN. They have PASSIONATE EMBRACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATHERINE cleans the bathroom of EXCESSIVE BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits on the other side of the PRIVACY SCREEN -- REFLECTING, in a GLUM FOG, listening. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She WRINGS OUT a washcloth frequently as she speaks. The EXCESSIVE BLOOD AND WATER falling into a BUCKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have finished by now, but the police wouldn't let me touch anything. They didn't believe it was suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She WIPES A MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was so much blood everywhere. They had fun making me do a reconstruction. "She went there."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes another GLASS SURFACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She came through here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the curtain to the SHOWER/TUB. It's INUNDATED w BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She opened the curtain."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STARES at the blood... It's so much. She uses the SHO HEAD to rinse the blood off the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I copied all her actions. The guests were awake all night! The hotel was crawling with cops! They enjoy playing around with blood. She rinses the blood FROM HER HANDS AND ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were all spies! Asking if she was sad, if she was happy, if you fought, how long you'd been married, why you didn't have any children. Pigs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted and exhausted, she sits on the edge of the tub. switch to PAUL'S SIDE of the PRIVACY SCREEN. We see he is DEEPLY DISTURBED by this situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got familiar right away! They said, "Your boss is a bit unstable." "Do you know that he was a boxer?" So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It didn't work out, so he became an actor." "Bongo player, revolutionary in South America, journalist in Japan."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to clean blood from THE STRAIGHT RAZOR Paul's used to KILL HERSELF WITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, he lands in Tahiti, hangs around, Learns French." "Then he comes to Paris. There... he meets a woman with money, marries her and... "Since then what has your boss done?" "Nothing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls the curtains aside from the window. He looks o He SPIES a BLACK COUPLE, one a SAX PLAYER, in an adjacent building. She is attempting ORAL SEX on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, "Can I clean up now?" "No! Don't touch anything!" "Do you really think she killed herself?" He pushed me into a corner and tried to paw me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the couple are spotted, they stop. He starts PLAYING SAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul has had enough of the running water and her cleaning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the tap off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be doing the autopsy right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you turn the tap off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me to give you your razor back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the STRAIGHT RAZOR. He STUDIES IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not mine. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they don't need it any more. The investigation is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her hands VIOLENTLY and studies them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she had cuts there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tilts her head back FORCEFULLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and on the neck, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PULLS HER OUT OF THE WAY and turns off the water. He p the SHOWER CURTAIN closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out of the bathroom, leaving Catherine there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he is gone, she opens the curtain and turns the wate back on OUT OF SPITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formerly known as the Passy Viaduct. We see a great shot the DOUBLE-DECKER ROAD-AND-RAIL BRIDGE and PAUL'S NEW APARTMENT BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Jeanne's hand comes in, holding KEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of her peeks in. She SPIES A CAT. She decides to make CRAZY NOISES at the animal, CRAWLING ON THE FLOOR, making it RUN FOR THE HILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, MOVERS pop in carrying furniture catching Jean off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where shall I put this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have rung the bell. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was open. I'll put it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the chair down in the middle of the room. She mov it to in front of the fireplace instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads to the front door but is stopped by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With and armfull of chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to leave again but then runs into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know? He'll decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne REGARDS the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a king-size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't fit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your husband has no idea. All this in an hour... It's not long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans against a wall and looks around, FLABBERGASTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a mess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Paul in the DOORWAY paying the movers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne is sitting in the chair in front of the fire place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armchair goes in front of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DRAGS THE CHAIR AND HER to the window instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I only came to return the key. To return it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the key. Take your coat off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his COAT OFF and hangs it on a DOOR HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your coat off and help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those chairs and bring them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the TABLE and brings it to the DINING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places the table. She FOLLOWS with the CHAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them on the other side. Take that, too. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't waste any time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has WANDERED OFF to another room. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen monsieur! I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, sir! I've got to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across the mattresses with her BOOTS ON. Paul l against the wall STUDYING THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed is too big for the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to know mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! I don't. I don't want to know your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He COVERS HER MOUTH and backs her up agianst a WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a name and I don't have a name either. Not one name. She THROWS HIS HAND off and puts some space between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans against the adjacent wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I am, but I don't want to know anything about you. I don't wanna know where you live or where you come from. I wanna know nothing, nothing, nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the OTHER WALL. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I are gonna meet here without knowing anything that goes on outside here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates OUTSIDE THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... Because we don't need names here. Don't you see? We're gonna forget... everything that we knew. Every... All the people,... all that we do,... wherever we live. We're going to forget that, everything, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the bed, inviting him with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSA'S MOTHER roots through Paul and Rosa's belongings. Searching for answers... and maybe some tokens of her DECEASED DAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul WAITS, listening in the HALLWAY. He loathes the upco reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNOYED by all the RATTLING while she searches, he bites bullet and GOES IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CATCHES her in the ARMOIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops her ROOTING. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expected you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the first train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice the IRONY of the SIGN ON THE DOOR, it reads "PR (PRIVATE).

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Paul! How awful! How awful, Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks TIMIDLY up to Paul. After a moment, they EMBRAC each other in a GRIEF STRICKEN HUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grows BORED of the reunion, he TAPS HIS FINGERS on t closet he LEANS AGAINST, studying the accessories of the DECOR and her silly hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits, SPILLING HER GRIEF on Paul as if it is a THERAP SESSION.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papa is in bed with asthma. The doctor wouldn't let him come. It's better like that. I'm stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts RUMMAGING AGAIN, this time through Rosa's empt PURSES, spilling them out one at a time on the bed BEHIND PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that would explain... A letter, a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I told you, there's nothing, nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the purses and PUTS THEM BACK. She sits on the b in DESPAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little Rosa wouldn't have... Nothing for her mother. Not a word. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's useless to keep on searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even for you, her husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the ARMOIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to rest. I think room 12 is free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GATHERS HER BELONGINGS and leads her UP THE STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass some GUESTS coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa's Mother stops on the stairway, REFLECTING PAINFULLY

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With a razor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul goes on, IGNORING HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes in and puts her belongings on the BED.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What time did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. In the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I... I already told you on the phone... When I found her, I called the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul goes out to the HALLWAY to gather himself. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you called, Papa and I stayed up all night, talking about Rosa and you. Papa kept whispering, as if it had happened in our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa's mother thinks he LEFT. She YELLS.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is BROKEN OUT OF HIS TRANCE... the sudden yelling ha INCENSED HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PEERS ANGRILY at her in room 12.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she suffer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the Doctors. They're doing the autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns off the ANNOYING RUNNING WATER. He looks at hims in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She UNPACKS her suitcases on her bed. He rejoins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out some CARDS.

dialogues.speaker: ROSA'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I already had some announcement cards. I've seen a lot of death. I think of everything. I'll prepare her a beautiful room with flowers. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cards, clothes, relatives, flowers. You've got everything in that suitcase. You didn't forget anything. But I don't want any priests here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No priests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to. Funerals must be religious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul EXPLODES -- She jumps a foot back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DARES HER with his eyes, ENRAGED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa didn't believe! Nobody believes in the fucking God here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws her suitcase AGAINST THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, don't shout. Don't talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNATCHES THE PAPER from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest doesn't want any suicides. The Church doesn't want any suicides, do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll give her absolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RAISES HIS HAND threatening to HIT HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared, she pushes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolution and a nice mass. That's all I ask, Paul. Rosa... Rosa is my little girl, do you understand? Rosa... Why did she kill herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts WEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why did she commit suicide? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PUMMELS THE DOOR with his fists ... ENRAGED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know? You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes her DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the OTHER GUESTS pop their heads out to see what COMMOTION IS. He gently CLOSES THEIR DOORS in a "mind you own business" sort of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is always the "Miss know it all, busybody type" tho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sheepishly REOPENS HER DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks calmly back to it and SLAMS IT in her face --- IRATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne enters the ALREADY OPEN DOOR. She looks around the still sparsely furnished living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul has decided his BED FITS BETTER in here. The BOTTOM MATTRESS is on the floor in the MIDDLE OF THE ROOM. He LE AGAINST THE WALL and top mattress, WAITING FOR JEANNE. He knew she'd be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She TAKES A SEAT on the bottom mattress and takes off her boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her and does the same with his shoes. KICKING OFF and CATCHING THEM in the air PLAYFULLY. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jeanne sit NUDE, entwined, WRAPPED AROUND EACH OTHERS BODY'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOh... Now... Let's... Let's just look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful without knowing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They REGARD each other for seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... Maybe we can come without touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come without touching? OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans his head back and CLOSES his eyes... SCREWING UP FACE. She COPIES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you concentrating? Did you come yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's difficult!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't either yet. You're not trying hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They STOP THE SILLINESS. They laugh. She wraps her arms around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall have to invent a name for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name? Oh, Jesus Christ! Oh, God, I've been called by a million names all my life. I don't want a name. I'm better off with a grunt or a groan for a name. Do you wanna hear my name? 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul does some PLAYFUL ANIMAL SOUNDS. APE SOUNDING GRUNTS such. He contorts his face and LOOKS SILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so masculine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mimics his idea and makes her own PLAYFUL ANIMAL SOUN He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get the last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She redoes the SOUNDS for him. He JOINS her. Their ANIMAL SOUNDS BLEED INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his FILM CREW record the ducks for b.g. SOUND CLI while they WAIT FOR JEANNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This includes ROOSTERS, PIGEONS and annoyed NAIL FILING b one of the CREW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINALLY, Jeanne opens the gate door, sheepishly. She is L and has a DIFFERENT HAIR STYLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is MIFFED, for continuity sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have done that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is much more EXCITED about the NEW PERM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a wig, it's my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She CLOSES THE GATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it suit me? Tell me, don't you like it? Tell me. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I like it. Listen, you know... I don't know. You have changed, and yet you haven't. I can see the shot now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twirls around, setting up the shot between his hands a his MINDS EYE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is up high. It descends slowly and follows you. You come forward, and it moves in on you. There's music, too. It gets closer and closer to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a hurry. Let's start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She MOSEYS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... can't we talk a little first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we improvise. You follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne kneels in front of a HEAD STONE that reads "Mustap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my childhood friend. He used to watch me for hours and hours. I think he understood me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE from behind Jeanne pipes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs are worth more than people. Much more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne smiles, FAMILIAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet Olympia, my nanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustapha could always tell the poor from the rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone well-dressed came in, he never stirred. But if someone scruffy came in, you should have seen him! What a dog! The colonel trained him to recognise Arabs by their scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia, open the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne stands and KISSES HER on the cheek through the gat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia is a compendium of domestic virtues. Faithful, admiring, and racist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch Olympia walk to the MANOR HOUSE as Jeanne WAXES NOSTALGIC. Slowly, the rest of the property is revealed t us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Papa died, we moved back to the family home for a while. My childhood was made up of smells. Musty smells, the smell of walls and rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF KIDS runs into the yard. Children used to come and play in my jungle, all day long. Growing old is a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne holds up a PICTURE. She points to people as she describes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me there. And that's Mademoiselle Sauvage, the teacher. She was very strict... and very religious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia CHIMES IN AGAIN from behind the CAMERA CREW. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was too good. She spoilt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camera Crew turns the camera on her. Jeanne has a DIFFERENT PICTURE, pointing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Christine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn back to Jeanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my best friend. She married the pharmacist and has two children. It's like a village here. We all know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia chimes in again from behind, in an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't live in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera turns on her, then back to Jeanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're safe here. It's odd looking at the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it odd? It's you! It's fantastic, it's your childhood. It's everything I was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on his camera crew who is UNDER HIS HEELS, shewi them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to? Move it! Move it! (to the lead crewman) Who are these zombies who are always following you around? (to all of them) Scoot! Go on! The door, the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts opening all the doors in the MANOR. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm opening the door. I'm opening all the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setting up my shot. There it is! That's it! I've found it. Reverse gear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia is loitering in one of the rooms he comes in. Ima her nerve, in her own house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is the typical RUDE FRENCH DIVA DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing there? Beat it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his attention back to Jeanne, the subject of his OBSESSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Into reverse. Yes! Do you see? Like a car, you go into reverse gear. That's it. Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes. He guides her BACKWARDS by the shoul through the MANOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start reversing. Close your eyes. That's it, come on. Come on backwards. That's it. Go back to your childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne BACKS TO a ROW OF PICTURES. She touches each and recalls the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're soaring. Take off and return to your childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In full uniform. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. Overcome the obstacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa in Algeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts a COUNTDOWN of ages, as if he is HYPNOTIZING HE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne backs into a DESK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne kneels down in front of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite route when I was eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls under A TABLE. She finds a NOTEBOOK in a SECRE HIDING SPOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My old notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reads from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French homework. Theme: the countryside. Exposition: the countryside is cow country. The cow is all dressed in leather. The cow has four sides: the front, the back, the top and the bottom. Isn't that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beastly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reads on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are my cultural sources. Le Grand Larousse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just copied from it. Menstruation. Noun. Physiological function comprising the discharge of menses. Penis. Noun. Male copulation organ, measuring five to forty centimeters. That's Le Petit Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows him a PICTURE she has found that she DREW AS A CHILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom! Tom! Tom! Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin Paul. My first love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He played the piano divinely. That's how I remember him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne and Tom walk BUNDLED TOGETHER as Jeanne REMINISCES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at the piano... His fingers would skim the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FILM CREW follow them, filming. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia stumbles behind, watching.

dialogues.speaker: JEANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He played for hours and hours. At the bottom of the garden, there were two big trees. A plane tree and a chestnut tree. After mass on Sundays, we used to sit there, each under our own tree. It was wonderful. We sat gazing into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All WANDER THE GARDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't my trees beautiful? They were my jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come upon the CROWD OF KIDS again. One KID is squatt behind some thatch, doing his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy pooping stops and PULLS UP HIS PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're doing a poo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne SCOLDS THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame on you, doing it in my jungle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SCATTER towards the STONE WALL with Olympia and Crew CHASING AFTER THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, these dirty little Arabs! Go and shit in your own country!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids CLIMB THE WALL for escape from the CRAZY ADULTS. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep filming. Keep filming! Don't stop, whatever you do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom wanders back over to Jeanne while Olympia and the Cre continue to SCARE OFF THE KIDS in the b.g..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia was great. It'll give a good idea of race relations in the suburbs of Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a real jungle here. So, tell me about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meeting someone for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the colonel... the colonel! But Jeanne is OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back at Paul's new place. Jeanne WANDERS THE ROOM TOPLESS but covering her breasts with a PILLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to WAX NOSTALGIC about her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colonel had green eyes and shiny boots. I worshipped him. He was so handsome in his uniform. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a steaming pile of horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed, she THROWS THE PILLOW she was covering her AMPLE BREAST with at Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see Paul is LOUNGING ON HIS MATTRESS, pant legs ro up past his knees, TOYING WITH A HARMONICA and drinking f a WOODEN CUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All uniforms are bullshit. Everything outside this place is bullshit. Besides, I don't want to hear about your stories, about your past, and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died in Algeria in 58...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or 68 or 28 or 98...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58, and don't joke about things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, why don't you stop talking about things that don't matter here? What the hell's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She huffs over to the other SIDE OF THE ROOM, crossing he arms, POUTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I have to say? What do I have to do!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on to his back to evince his CROTCH. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on the good ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lollipop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PLAYS A TUNE on his harmonica. She sneaks onto the bed THE SHADOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go back in America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops PLAYING THE TUNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Bad memories, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... My father was a... a drunk. Tough. Whore-fucker, bar-fighter. Super-masculine. And he was tough. My mother was very... Very poetic. And also a drunk. And... one of my memories, when I was a kid, was of her being arrested nude. We lived in this small town. Farming community. We lived on a farm. And I'd come home after school and she'd be gone. In jail... or something. And... I used to... I used to have to milk a cow every morning and every night and I liked that. I remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IRISH COUNTRY JIG plays over the MONOLOGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time I was all dressed up to go out and take this girl to a basketball game. And I started to go out and my father said, "You have to milk the cow." I said, "Would you please milk it for me?" And he said, "No, get your ass out there." So I went out and I was in a hurry and didn't have time to change my shoes. And I had cow shit all over my shoes. And on the way to the basketball game, it smelled in the car. I don't know. I-I can't remember very many good things. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Some. There was a farmer, a very nice guy. Old guy, very poor, and worked real hard. I used to work in a ditch, draining land for farming. And he wore overalls and he smoked a clay pipe. Half the time he wouldn't put tobacco in it. And I hated the work. It was hot and dirty and... it broke my back. And... all day long I'd watch his spit which would run down the pipe stem and hang on the bowl of the pipe. And I used to make bets with myself on when it was going to fall off. And I always lost. I never saw it fall off. I'd just look around and it'd be gone and then the new one would be there. And then we had a beautiful... My mother... My mother taught me to love nature. And... I guess that was the most she could do. And... we had... In front of our house we had this big field... meadow. It was a mustard field in the summer and we had a big black dog named Dutchy. And she used to hunt for rabbits in that field but she couldn't see them. So she'd have to leap up in this mustard field and look around very quickly to see where the rabbits were. And it was... very beautiful. And she never caught the rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne looks up from the bed, MISCHIEVOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been had!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna know anything about your past, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I was telling you the truth? 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne flaps her arms. Paul TWILLS his eyebrows in respon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne climbs on the bed with the top sheet like a LIONES STALKING her prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Red Riding Hood and you're the wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She COVERS HIM UP with the sheet. Then she uncovers his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What strong arms you have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SNIFFS HIS ARM. Paul PLAYS ALONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The better to squeeze a fart out of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plays with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What long nails you have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The better to scratch your ass with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She REACHES UNDER the sleeve of his shirt to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what a lot of fur you have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Jeanne comes in carrying her FUR COLLARED COAT, purse and BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks the door shut with her foot. She wanders to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws her coat and purse on the table. She puts a PORTABLE RECORD PLAYER in the BASSINET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other room we hear Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's butter in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that Paul is laying on the floor eating bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're here? Why didn't you answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get the butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to hurry. I have a cab waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get the butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STORMS into the kitchen. Paul continues eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes out and THROWS THE BUTTER on the floor in front him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the floor and opens a MIRRORED door on a cabi We see PAUL'S REFECTION IN IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're so damned sure that I'm coming back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs at her. She sits on her HAUNCHES, then her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think that an American sitting on the floor in an empty flat eating cheese and drinking water is interesting? 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He NODS YES. She knocks on the FLOOR near her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something under here. Can you hear it? It's hollow. Can you hear it? It's hollow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's a hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crawls toward her. We see Jeanne's reflection in a MIR behind him. He reaches toward the hollow spot. She SLAPS HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Don't open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to her CROTCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that? Can I open that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for it but she MOVES AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Wait a minute. Maybe there's jewels in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to UNDO HER PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PULLS THE BUTTER OVER WITH HIS FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He YANKS HER by the legs CLOSER TO HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always afraid. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FLIPS HER ON HER stomach, violently. She is not in the SAME GAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but... maybe there is some family secrets inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family secrets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RIPS HER PANTS DOWN TO HER ANKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you about family secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets a HAND FULL OF BUTTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna tell you about the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He YANKS her pants down enough to put his HAND FULL OF BU in her ASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That holy institution meant to breed virtue in savages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SPREADS the butter in her ASS as she STRUGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to repeat it after me. He MOUNTS HER, opening his ZIPPER. She STRUGGLES more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No and no! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat it. Say, "Holy family." Come on, say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her arms, stopping her from STRUGGLING as he SODOMIZES HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Holy family. Church of good citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is WEEPING. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Church...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good citizens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She CRIES OUT in pain as he enters her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smacks her savagely on the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it. Say it! The children are tortured until they tell their first lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children... are tortured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her MUFFLED CRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the will is broken by repression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the will... broken... repression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEARS STREAM DOWN her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where freedom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free... Freedom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..is assassinated. Freedom is assassinated by egotism. Family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DRIVES IT HOME TILL HE COMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You... You... You f... You... fucking... fucking... family. You fucking... family! Oh, God... Jesus. Oh, you... Oh... 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He COLLAPSES on her, SPENT as she continues to WEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAIN ROARS by on the TRAIN BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is SLEEPING on the floor amidst the BREAD AND BUTTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another couple of TRAINS go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul SLEEPS more. On his STOMACH now, with his foot on a piece of FURNITURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne puts a record on the RECORD PLAYER she brought wit her. She goes to plug it into the FLOOR PLUG but gets an ELECTRICAL SHOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her UPSIDE DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a surprise for you. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at himself in a SMALL MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a surprise for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. I like surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FLIPS HIMSELF over backwards onto his feet. He walks o to her and the RECORD PLAYER. He stares down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music. But I don't know how to work it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits on the FLOOR next to her. He plugs in the RECORD PLAYER. He JUMPS as he gets an ELECTRICAL SHOCK. Jeanne i secretly amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you enjoy that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets the RECORD PLAYING. It's some 70's HIPPY MUSIC. Jeanne sways to it while Paul reads the JACKET COVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Jeanne sit, ROMANTICALLY ENTWINED on a SEA WALL w his FILM CREW films in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit FACE TO FACE, he holds her shoulders and stares her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why I sent the others away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're angry, or you want to be alone with me? 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do I want to be alone with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something really serious to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something really very serious to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it happy or sad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's happy. What sort of secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his FILM CREW dolly around them in the b.g., his SOUND PERSON yells at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak up! I can't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...between a man and a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it dirty or is it about love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About love. But that's not all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret about love, but which isn't love. What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a LIFE PRESERVER over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila. That in a week I'm marrying you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm marrying you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm marrying you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're marrying me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Are we getting married or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, yes, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She take the life preserver off and THROWS IT IN THE WATE Together, they WATCH IT SINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEANNE'S MOTHER beats the dirt off her LATE HUSBANDS MILI JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'll send everything to the country. What do you think, Jeanne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne tries on another of her FATHERS MILITARY UNIFORMS complete with HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympia will be happy. I went there yesterday with Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother joins her inside. She carries the FATHERS BOOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's preparing a family museum. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'm not sending the boots. I'm keeping them with me. I get strange shivers when I touch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne goes into an ADJOINING ROOM while her mom continue reflecting, IRONING the JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: JEANNE'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All these military things never age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up just in time to see that Jeanne has found he fathers gun and is pointing it in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little, it seemed really heavy when Papa taught me how to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm keeping that here. In a respectable household, it's useful to have a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know how to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing is to have one. It makes an impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really kept everything of Papa's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows her mom a picture she has scrounged up from her FATHERS WALLET of a TOPLESS NEGRO FEMALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? His orderly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine example of a Berber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong race. I tried to employ them as servants, but it was disastrous. 'm glad I decided to send everything to the country. All his things were piling up and piling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You'll soon have all the space you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off the HAT and JACKET and throws them on the s She heads to the FRONT DOOR with MOM FOLLOWING, on pins a needles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame, the colonel's lady, I announce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom RUNS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this solemn day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What solemn day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She RUNS AFTER her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne is on the ELEVATOR. She sticks her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting married in a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door and HEADS DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom follows her down STEP FOR STEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Tom! In a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom! In a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his FILM CREW film Jeanne trying on wedding dress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He COUNTS DOWN to the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five... two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does the CLAPPER with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne and her HOST OF DRESSERS is lost in her fittings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move into shot! We're shooting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the center of the shop. We get another look at Jeanne's LEFT BREAST as it slips o of the dress being fitted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom fires off QUESTIONS for film purposes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So,... how do you see marriage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marriage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne gives her upbeat EXTISTENTIAL RESPONSES as her fit continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it everywhere. All the time. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, everywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On walls. On buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walls and buildings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, on advertising hoardings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they selling? Cars. Tinned meat. Cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're all about young couples. Before marriage, no children. Then the same couple, married with children. In short, marriage. The perfect, ideal, successful marriage. It's no longer the preserve of the Church. The husband was burdened with responsibilities and the wife nagged. Now, weddings in advertising smile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile. On posters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On posters, of course. But why t take poster marriage seriously? Marriage... Pop marriage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes out from under a DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop? That's the formula. For pop youth, pop marriage! But... what if the pop marriage doesn't work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have to fix it like you would a car. The spouses are two workers in overalls bending over an engine to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in case of adultery what happens to the pop marriage? 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, there are three or four workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about love? Is love pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's not. Love isn't pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love isn't pop. So what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workers retire to a secret flat, take off their overalls and become men and women again and make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fussing on the dress is finished. Jeanne slowly, PUTS HER GLOVES, relishing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STRUTS slowly for all to stare and LAVISH her in her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is CAPTIVATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the dress that makes the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than Rita Hayworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders out into the street. It is RAINING HEAVILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than Joan Crawford! Better than Kim Novak! Better than Lauren Bacall! Better than Ava Gardner when she was Mickey Rooney's lover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hes FILM CREW scatters for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Stop! Stop, but keep filming! Why aren't you filming in the rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They huddle underneath the DOOR of the FILM TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom has lost Jeanne in all the HUBUB. He is disgusted wit his CREW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to the SHOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jeanne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? ln the rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs down the street in the rain looking for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne! Jeanne! Jeanne! Jeanne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes POINDING in from the rain. He STOMPS the water his shoes. He breaks into an IMPROMPTU SOFT SHOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the gate to the ELEVATOR and gets on. He pushes button. The elevator STARTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please forgive me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stops the elevator. He SENDS IT BACK DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jeanne has been waiting on the ADJACENT STAIRS for Paul. She is still in her WEDDING DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She implores Paul from outside the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me! I wanted to leave you and I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to leave you and I couldn't. I can't. I can't leave you, do you understand? 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, PLEADING at the ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul does the EYEBROW TRILL. He opens the elevator so she get on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it ascends, Jeanne slowly RAISES HER DRESS, revealing UNDERWEAR and her AMPLE BUSH to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open. Paul comes in CARRYING Jeanne in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VoilГ !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts doing a JIG AND SONG... all the way to the MATTRESSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there once was a man And he had an old sow ow! Hi-diddle- dow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts her on the bed. She is GIGGLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pats her stomach and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne's SCREAMS come from the other room. He goes to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne screams BLOODY MURDER and points to a DEAD RAT on STILL UNMADE MATTRESS. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rat. Only a rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PICKS IT UP by the tail. She stumbles over herself to away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are more rats in Paris than people. Yum, yum, yum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds it out, OFFERING IT to her. She freaks. She runs the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings it to her... she continues to BACK PEDDLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! Don't you want a bite first? You don't want to run and eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the ASS of the RAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is the end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then points to the HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I like to start with the head. That's the best part. Are you sure you won't have any? OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DANGLES IT over his mouth, flitting his tounge, preten to eat it. She is gonna HURL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You don't dig rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go! I can't make love in this bed any more. I can't. It's disgusting! Nauseating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll fuck on the radiator or standing on the mantel. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the RAT again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I gotta get some mayonnaise for this. Because, it really is good with mayonnaise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads out, then stops and LOOKS BACK AT HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll save the asshole for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really leaves this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat's asshole with mayonnaise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LAUGHS at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanne is a BASKET CASE. She sits on her HAUNCHES, mutter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get out of here. I want to go. I can't stand it here any more. Yes. I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, gets her purse and goes to the door. We see ASS through the SHEER FABRIC of her wedding dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming back... ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is there, WAITING, NONCHALANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quo vadis, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you something. I fell in love with somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
